quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Queen and Elizabeth Ii
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, birds, widow. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Upon her accession to the throne, Elizabeth II became Head of the Commonwealth and queen regnant of seven independent Commonwealth countries. Which of these countries does not recognize her as queen?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: India

questions.question: Queen Elizabeth II is known for her love of these dogs and is known to have at least four of them in her retinue.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Welsh Corgi

questions.question: In 1947, Elizabeth II married Prince Philip who was a member of this countrys royal family.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Greece

questions.question: What happened to Nikita before she got transformed from a degenerate drug addict to a femme fatale into Luc Bessons self-titled thriller?

options.text: She was sentenced to life in prison.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: She was sentenced to life in prison.

questions.question: The Diamond Jubilee of Queen Elizabeth II marked the 60th anniversary of her accession to the throne. Who is the only other monarch in the history of the United Kingdom to have celebrated a Diamond Jubilee?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Queen Victoria

questions.question: In this ballet a young man, named Franz, becomes infatuated with a life-size dancing doll.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Coppelia

questions.question: Upon the death of her father, Elizabeth II was staying at the Treetops Hotel, built into the tops of the trees of the Aberdares National Park. In what country was Elizabeth II when she went up a princess and came down a queen?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kenya

questions.question: What movie stars Gloria Swanson as faded film star Norma Desmond who lures an aspiring screenwriter into her world of delusions?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sunset Boulevard

questions.question: The story of the movie Black Widow involves two women - a femme fatale (Theresa Russel) who preys on wealthy middle-aged men and a detective who grows obsessed with bringing her to justice. Who plays Justice Department agent Alexandra Barnes?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Debra Winger

questions.question: Queen Elizabeths official birthday has generally been celebrated on a selected day around the end of May to the start of June. In what month is her actual birthday?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: April

questions.question: All of which unmarked birds in England are owned by Queen Elizabeth II?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: mute swans

questions.question: Who of the following was NOT Prime Minister of the UK under Elizabeth II?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Clement Attlee

questions.question: Why did Queen Elizabeth II refer to 1992 as her annus horribilis (horrible year)?

options.text: Prince Harry was expelled from school.
It marked the breakdown of her childrens marriages.
Her mother and sister died in 1992.
Princes Diana died in a car crash in 1992.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It marked the breakdown of her childrens marriages.

questions.question: What Academy Award-winning actress portrays Queen Elizabeth II in the British drama The Queen, which depicts a fictional account of the events following the death of Princess Diana?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Helen Mirren

questions.question: A man was in his home, looking at a photograph. He used the following words to describe one particular person in that photograph. Brothers and sisters I have none: But that mans father is my fathers son. Who was he talking about?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Himself

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Ballet and Atomic Bomb
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, petits, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the name the character in Swan Lake which is generally known as the Black Swan?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Odile

questions.question: The music to which of these ballets was not composed by Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Don Quixote

questions.question: In the ballet La Sylphide, what is James doing in act one when a sylph (a forest fairy) gazes lovingly upon him?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: sleeping

questions.question: What country began working on developing an atomic weapon before the United States and eventually joined with the US in its development?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Great Britain

questions.question: Who composed the music to the classical ballet La Bayadere, which is in ancient India?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ludwig Minkus

questions.question: Hitler inadvertently helped the US to develop the atomic bomb by doing which of the following?

options.text: boasting that Germany had developed an atomic weapon
causing many Jewish physicists to leave Germany and eventually work on developing the bomb
selling the Soviet Union large stocks of uranium
announcing that Germany had developed long range aircraft that could bomb any US city

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: causing many Jewish physicists to leave Germany and eventually work on developing the bomb

questions.question: The Lilac Fairy and Carabosse represent the two main conflicting forces of good and evil in this famous ballet by Pyotr Tchaikovsky.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Sleeping Beauty

questions.question: Which character is not correctly matched with the ballet?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Swanhilda - Ciderella

questions.question: What ballet tells the story of a peasant girl whose ghost protects her lover after her premature death?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Giselle

questions.question: In what US state was much of the development of the atomic bomb and the first test of an atomic bomb carried out?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New Mexico

questions.question: What was the code word for the secret project to develop the atomic bomb?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Manhattan Project

questions.question: Name the American physicist who led the team of scientists and engineers who developed the atomic bomb.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert Oppenheimer

questions.question: How many dancers traditionally perform the Danse des petits cygnes (Dance of the Little Swans) in Swan Lake?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 4

questions.question: Who made the final decision to drop atomic bombs on Japan?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: President Truman

questions.question: What ballet features a battle between an army of Gingerbread man soldiers and the mice, led by the Mouse King?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Nutcracker

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Agatha Christie and Japan
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, leader, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of the following is not a recurring character in the Hercule Poirot stories?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Moffat

questions.question: Ray Bradbury was greatly inspired by American author Edgar Rice Burroughs. Which of these famous novels was penned by Burroughs?

options.text: A Journey to the Center of the Earth
The Fall of the House of Usher

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tarzan of the Apes

questions.question: The precise number of people killed at Hiroshima by the atomic bomb is not known due to destruction of records, etc.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 80,000

questions.question: Who was Agatha Christies second husband?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Max Mallowan

questions.question: What is the first name of Miss Marple, one of Agatha Christies most famous creations?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jane

questions.question: Why was Hiroshima  chosen as the target of the first atomic bomb dropped on Japan?

options.text: Hiroshima had suffered almost no damage from conventional bombing, so it could be possible to discern how much damage would the atomic bomb cause.
It was the second largest industrial city of Japan.
The Japanese emperors summer home was in Hiroshima.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hiroshima had suffered almost no damage from conventional bombing, so it could be possible to discern how much damage would the atomic bomb cause.

questions.question: Which  Billy Wilder film, starring Marlene Dietrich and Charles Laughton, was adapted from an Agatha Christie play?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Witness for the Prosecution

questions.question: Agatha Christie wrote a story called The Love Detectives, featuring a Mr Harley Quin.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What leader of a nation besides the US and Britain had some information about the development of the atomic bomb in the US?

options.text: Chiang Kai-shek of China because the US informed him about the project
De Gaulle of France because several French scientists worked on the project
Stalin of the Soviet Union because of Soviet spies

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stalin of the Soviet Union because of Soviet spies

questions.question: What is emblazoned on the arm of Guy Montags uniform in Ray Bradburys dystopian novel Fahrenheit 451?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a salamander

questions.question: After US forces captured this island, a major air base was built there because it was close enough to Japan. The plane that dropped the first atomic bomb on Japan flew from the base on this island.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tinian

questions.question: Which of these films is not based on a book by Agatha Christie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Murder Ahoy

questions.question: Which of the following characters was not created by Agatha Christie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mr J. G. Reeder

questions.question: Ray Bradbury was free to start a career in writing when he was rejected admission into the military during World War II due to this condition.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: bad eyesight

questions.question: What was the Agatha Christie novel that related Hercule Poirots final adventure?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Curtain

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Ray Bradbury and Novels
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, marvil, june. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In The Clique, Dylans famous mother, Merri-Lee Marvil, is the host of what famous morning talkshow?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Daily Grind

questions.question: In which of his novels does Ray Bradbury describe a nightmarish traveling carnival called Cooger  Darks Pandemonium Shadow Show?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Something Wicked This Way Comes

questions.question: Ray Bradbury died on June 5, 2012, at the age of 91 during what rare astronomical event?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: transit of Venus

questions.question: What private school do the Clique members attend in the Clique series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Octavian Country Day

questions.question: In which books did Alicia try to tear apart the Clique?

options.text: Best Friends for Never, Revenge of the Wannabes
A Tale of Two Pretties, My Little Phony
Revenge of the Wannabes, Boys R Us
These Boots are Made for Stalking, A Tale of Two Pretties

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Revenge of the Wannabes, Boys R Us

questions.question: Why is Kristen  different from the rest of the original Clique girls?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Why did Claire move in in the book The Clique?

options.text: It is part of a foreign exchange program.
Her dad was an old college friend of Massies dad.
Her mom is always offering their guesthouse to the less fortunate.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Her dad was an old college friend of Massies dad.

questions.question: In Ray Bradburys book The Martian Chronicles, upon seeing their home planet Earth dwindle to the size of a pin dot, most colonisers succumb to this disease.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the Great Loneliness

questions.question: In what book of The Clique series does Claire move in Massies room during renovations?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Invasion of the Boy Snatchers

questions.question: In Dial L for Loser, Alicias cousin Nina visits and tears apart the Clique.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What is Ray Bradburys home city of Waukegan called in some of his novels?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Green Town

questions.question: What filmmaker stated that Ray Bradbury was [his] muse for the better part of [his] sci-fi career?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Steven Spielberg

questions.question: In 1971, an impact crater on Earths moon was named by the Apollo 15 astronauts in honor of one of Ray Bradburys novels. What is the name of the crater?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dandelion Crater

questions.question: In 1953, Ray Bradbury was hired by John Huston to work on the screenplay of the movie adaptation of this famous classic novel.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Moby-Dick

questions.question: Where did the Clique characters meet?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A New Years Yves Party

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Names and London
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, g., massies. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Select the names of E. B. White.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elwyn Brooks

questions.question: Who are Massies crushes in The Clique series of books?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chris, Landon, Derrington, Cam

questions.question: On what famous London street does famous detective Sherlock Holmes live?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Baker Street

questions.question: Where does Massie move in the last book of The Clique series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: London

questions.question: What are the names of author J. P. Donleavy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Patrick

questions.question: What famous character depicted by Bram Stoker goes to London in order to seduce Mina Harker?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dracula

questions.question: What are the names of E. L. Doctorow?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Edgar Lawrence

questions.question: Select the names of J. D. Salinger.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jerome David

questions.question: What are the first names of author D. H. Lawrence?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: David Herbert

questions.question: Pick the correct first and middle names of C. S. Lewis.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Clive Staples

questions.question: Select the names of J. R. R. Tolkien.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Ronald Reuel

questions.question: Select the names of P. G. Wodehouse.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pelham Grenville

questions.question: Select the first and middle name of H. G. Wells.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Herbert George

questions.question: Which is the only novel by Charles Dickens that doesnt have scenes set in London?

questions.question: What are the names of H. P.  Lovecraft?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Battle and London
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, smith, summer. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In which battle was Stonewall Jackson killed?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chancellorsville

questions.question: What author described a day in the life of Mrs Dalloway, who goes around London in the morning, getting ready to host a party?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Virginia Woolf

questions.question: Name the author of the The Time Machine, The Invisible Man and The War of the Worlds, all of which have scenes set in London.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: H. G. Wells

questions.question: Which battle saw the defence of the Sunken Road or Bloody Lane as it was called after the battle?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Antietam

questions.question: This novel is said to be about migration, metamorphosis, divided selves, love, death, London and Bombay. Following a violent riot against the novel, the Supreme Leader of Iran issued a fatwa calling on all good Muslims to kill its author.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Satanic Verses

questions.question: What battle of the American Civil war raged for 12 days from 8 may to 19 May 1864?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Spotsylvania Court House

questions.question: What novel opens on a beautiful summer day with Lord Henry Wotton observing artist Basil Hallwards work?

options.text: A Portrait of the Artist as a Young Man

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Picture of Dorian Gray

questions.question: The site of this 1862 battle had been the scene of a previous battle?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Second Bull Run

questions.question: Ulysses Grant had been given top command in the west, before the battle of Shiloh.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Winston Smith, the protagonist of this novel lives in London, the chief city of Airstrip One.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nineteen Eighty-Four

questions.question: What was the first major battle of the Eastern Theater of the American Civil War?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bull Run

questions.question: Becky Sharp, a strong-willed and cunning young woman, is the protagonist of this classic novel.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vanity Fair

questions.question: What fictional character is blown by the East wind to 17Cherry Tree Lane, London, and into the Banks household to care for their children?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mary Poppins

questions.question: Which battle featured the defence of Maryes Heights?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fredericksburg

questions.question: Which of these is not a battle of the Seven Days Battles?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bunker Hill
